how would you describe your main use cas: Note-taking;Journalling;Task and project management (including CRMs);As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content);Narrative fiction writing (either supporting its creation or directly writing in TiddlyWiki)
do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: No, but I may export content into other formats and share individual tiddlers, the whole wiki, or an extract of the wiki
putting it all together, what value does: Secure, portable environment to write in, take notes, customize, and be a single source of truth.
what is your level of ability with tiddl: I have customised TiddlyWiki through options and plugins;I am comfortable using WikiText widgets (e.g. <$transclude>, <$list>...)
how do you save changes in tiddlywiki?: Single-file wiki through web browser with Download Saver (default saving mechanism);Single-file wiki with custom saver (e.g. TiddlyPWA, Timimi, tw5-browser-nativesaver)
we would love to know what your basic se: I work of a several single files in TiddlyHost - but I keep files in Google Drive a well.  When editing or working with a file, I download it and work on it, then upload it to Tiddlyhost and Google Drive.  On mobile, I use Tiddlyhost for viewing.
what are we doing well? prompts for thin: Active development breeds confidence in the project and makes me feel safe in keep privileged information in it.
what could we do better? prompts for thi: Technical limitations aside, my biggest issue is slow-downs with large files (PKM).  I tweak (no images, limited plug-ins, etc), but with some tiddlers large (I know - atomize those Tiddlers!) and a thousands of tiddlers, the slowdown is noticeable and that gives me pause as to whether this is the right platform.
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
title: Community Survey 2025 Answer 00094
